methods.description: Returns a current bitshare address for receiving payments to this account. If <account_name> does not exist, it will be created along with an associated new address that will be returned.

parameters.name: account_name
parameters.description: the account's name associated with this address

methods.description: Returns the account associated with the given address.

parameters.name: account_address
parameters.description: the address of this account

methods.description: Reveals the private key corresponding to <bitsharesaddress>

parameters.name: account_address
parameters.description: bitshares address of the private key, base58 string hash of public key

methods.description: Encrypts the wallet with <passphrase>.

parameters.name: passphrase
parameters.description: the passphrase for encrypt

methods.description: Attempts add or remove <node> from the peer list or try a connection to <node> once, see network_add_node

parameters.name: node
parameters.description: The node (see network_get_peer_info for nodes)

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: 'add' to add a node to the list, 'remove' to remove a node from the list, 'onetry' to try a connection to the node once

methods.description: Safely backup wallet data to destination, which can be a directory or a path with filename.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: the full path and filename of wallet file to generate

methods.description: Returns the list of addresses for the given account.

parameters.name: account_name
parameters.description: the account's name associated with this address list

methods.description:
If [account] is not specified, returns the server's total available balance.
If [account] is specified, returns the balance in the account.

parameters.name: account_name
parameters.description: The account to list the balance of.

methods.description: eturns information about the block with the given hash.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: the id of the block to return

methods.description: Returns the number of blocks in the longest block chain
Returns hash of block in best-block-chain at index provided

parameters.name: block_number
parameters.description: index of the block

methods.description: Returns the number of fully-established connections to other nodes
Returns an object containing various state info.
Returns a new bitcoin address for receiving payments. If [account] is specified payments received with the address will be credited to [account].

parameters.name: account_name
parameters.description: the name you will use to refer to this receive account

methods.description: Returns the amount received by <bitcoinaddress> in transactions. It correctly handles the case where someone has sent to the address in multiple transactions.

parameters.name: account_address
parameters.description: The received address

methods.description: Adds a private key (as returned by dumpprivkey) to your wallet. This may take a while, as a rescan is done, looking for existing transactions, see wallet_dump_private_key.

parameters.name: wif_key
parameters.description: A private key in bitcoin Wallet Import Format (WIF)

parameters.name: account_name
parameters.description: the name of the account the key should be imported into, if null then the key must belong to an active account

parameters.name: rescan
parameters.description: If true, the wallet will rescan the blockchain looking for transactions that involve this private key

methods.description: Returns Object that has account names as keys, account balances as values. TODO: balance in result type is asset
Returns up to [count] most recent transactions skipping the first [from] transactions for account [account]. If [account] not provided it'll return recent transactions from all accounts.

parameters.name: account_name
parameters.description: the name of the account for which the transaction history will be returned

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: the number of transactions will be returned

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: the position of transaction will be skipped from

methods.description: TODO: <amount> is a real and is rounded to 8 decimal places. Will send the given amount to the given address, ensuring the account has a valid balance using [minconf] confirmations. Returns the transaction ID if successful (not in JSON object).

parameters.name: fromaccount
parameters.description: the source account(s) to draw the shares from

parameters.name: toaddress
parameters.description: the address to send

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: the amount of shares to transfer

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: a memo to store with the transaction

methods.description: amounts are double-precision floating point numbers

parameters.name: fromaccount
parameters.description: the source account(s) to draw the shares from

parameters.name: to_address_amounts
parameters.description: the public_key to send

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: a memo to store with the transaction

methods.description: <amount> is a real and is rounded to 8 decimal places. Returns the transaction ID <txid> if successful.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: the address to send

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: the amount of shares to transfer

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: a memo to store with the transaction

methods.description: <amount> is a real and is rounded to the nearest 0.00000001.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: the amount of the fee

methods.description: Sign a message with the private key of an address.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: the address of the private key

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: the massage to sign

methods.description: Return information about <address>.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: the address of the private key

methods.description: Verify a signed message.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: the address of the private key

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: the signature of the massage

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: the massage signed

methods.description: Removes the wallet encryption key from memory, locking the wallet. After calling this method, you will need to call walletpassphrase again before being able to call any methods which require the wallet to be unlocked.
Stores the wallet decryption key in memory for <timeout> seconds.

parameters.name: passphrase
parameters.description: the passphrase for encrypting the wallet

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: the number of seconds to keep the wallet unlocked

methods.description: Changes the wallet passphrase from <oldpassphrase> to <newpassphrase>

parameters.name: oldpassphrase
parameters.description: the old passphrase for encrypting the wallet

parameters.name: newpassphrase
parameters.description: the new passphrase for encrypting the wallet
